sources.full: Codex Asteriae; Spellbook of the Stars

spell.name: Astral Flame
entries: A blackish-purple orb shoots out from your casting object, crashing into one target, before erupting into a bright light and dealing {@damage 1d6} fire damage. The heat of a star is quickly cloaked by the unforgiving cold of empty space, dealing a further {@damage 1d4} cold damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: Each level adds another {@dice D6} / {@dice D4}.

spell.name: Cloak of Darkness
entries: Cloak yourself in the darkness of the night sky. While hiding in the day, this spell grants a +2 to stealth checks while hiding in the shadows. At night, however, the spell grants a general +4 to all stealth checks.

spell.name: Embrace of Night
entries: A wave of pure darkness erupts from before you, covering those within range. Targets must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw, or are plunged into the endless, freezing void. A target who fails is {@condition blinded} for two turns and suffers {@damage 2d6} cold damage. On a successful save, the target takes damage with no blindness.

spell.name: Guiding Moonlight
entries: Call upon the wisdom of the shattered moon for assistance. Upon a successful cast, you or the target you have touched are granted a +2 to a single Wisdom or Intelligence skill check.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: With each level upcasted, the bonus increases by 1.

spell.name: Guiding Starlight
entries: Call upon the stars to guide you to safety. When cast, stars in the sky will appear brighter and will guide the caster away from danger, such as a looming military patrol, a bandit ambush, or perhaps an encounter with a creature. The Stars will also act as a guide to those who are lost, guiding someone to the closest populated location (A tavern, a village, etc.)
If Guiding Starlight is used in the day, the caster must succeed on a DC6 Visual Perception check to actually be able to follow the path.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When upcast at level two, Guiding Starlight no longer needs a perception check to succeed.

spell.name: Lesser Aurora

components.m: A firefly, or a small piece of a glowing substance.

entries: A kaleidoscope of green, red and purple light weaves in the air, casting a glow in all directions within a 40ft radius. Creatures within the glow of the Aurora have a disadvantage on stealth checks. Any attack roll against a creature visible within the glow has advantage, friend or foe.

spell.name: Lesser Stargazer’s Aid

components.m: A petal belonging to a moonflower

entries: Offering a petal with an open palm, channel your faith to the stars while gazing in the direction of the moon. Upon a successful cast, you will be granted darkvision beneath the night sky for a duration of three hours. Darkvision granted by the night sky, unsurprisingly, does not work within closed spaces such as deep caves, or tombs.

spell.name: Overwhelming Presence
entries: Mutter a sentence in the language of our forefathers while glaring at your target, before cursing them with incomprehensible knowledge. Upon a successful cast, the target feels a searing headache, coupled with taking {@damage 2d6} psychic damage as their mind is overwhelmed by the mere presence of outer space. This spell automatically fails if cast upon a fellow Astral mage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When cast with a higher-level spell slot, add an additional {@dice 1d6} to the damage roll.

spell.name: Selina’s Comet

components.m: A small bit of water, and a small rock.

entries: Toss your components into the air, allowing them to fall into the abyss. Upon a successful cast, a small tear in space appears beside you, before a comet shoots out at great speed, drawn to your target. Upon impact, the comet deals {@damage 3d6} bludgeoning damage, followed by a further {@damage 1d6} cold damage dealt in a 10 feet radius.

The spell will always hit, but the target may take half damage if they succeed on a Dexterity or Constitution saving throw. For the AOE, a successful save will lead to no damage taken by those in the area.

spell.name: Wall of Astraeus
entries: Let the fear of the unknown take over. Pull the sky down and let it shield your allies. The Wall of Astraeus can be up to 30 feet wide, 30 feet high, and thick as parchment.

Upon a successful cast, any creature looking at the wall from a direction of the caster’s choosing must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw. Upon a failure, the target will suffer from {@damage 1d10} psychic damage and will be forced back 10 feet, hypnotised by the sight of the stars before them. Any ranged weapon fired through the wall will fail to penetrate, the attack instead being tossed into the outer cosmos. A creature can pass through the wall by rolling another Wisdom saving throw. Upon a failure, they will take both {@damage 1d10} psychic damage and {@damage 1d6} cold damage.
